sources.data_found: Compute2 basic infrastructure statistics include 64 Nvidia H100 GPUs.
Compute2 GPU compute nodes are listed as c2-gpu-[001-018] and GPU model listed as NVIDIA H100 80GB HBM3 (GPU-per-node not explicitly stated).
RIS Scientific Compute Platform (base system) lists 120 Nvidia Tesla V100 GPUs.
A&S Condo resources include 8 NVIDIA Ampere A100 PCIe 80GB GPUs.

RCIF/CHPC node table lists GPU nodes and GPU counts including: gpu01 (4x A100 40GB PCIe), gpua[401-412] (12 nodes, 4x A100-SXM-40 each), gpua[801-805] (5 nodes, 4x A100-SXM-80 each), gpuh[801-802] (2 nodes, 4x H100-SXM-80 each), multiple V100/V100S nodes, and gpugh01 (1x GH200).
Engineering Research Compute Cluster (LSF) lists: 12 NVIDIA A100 80GB SXM4 (3 nodes), 8 NVIDIA A100 80GB PCIe (1 node), and 16 NVIDIA A40 48GB (2 nodes).

student_data.notes: Searched for WashU CS/CSE enrollment counts explicitly labeled Fall 2024 or AY 2024-25. Found a CSE page listing "CSE quick facts" (737 undergraduate students, 217 graduate students, 100 PhD students), but the page does NOT explicitly state "Fall 2024", "2024", or "2024-2025", so those numbers were rejected per your date rules. Checked the official WashU Common Data Set 2024-2025 PDF (https://washu.edu/app/uploads/2025/06/2024-2025-WashU-CDS.pdf), which is labeled 2024-2025 and reports overall enrollment as of Oct 15, 2024, but it does not provide Computer Science major/program enrollment counts; sections with program/major figures are for degrees awarded in 2023-2024 and were rejected. Checked the Registrar Fall 2024 10th-week enrollment PDF (https://registrar.washu.edu/app/uploads/2024/11/Fall-2024-10th-week-enrollment.pdf), which is explicitly Fall 2024, but it reports enrollment by school/division/award level, not Computer Science program/major counts. No source meeting your explicit 2024+ labeling requirement was found for CS undergrad/MS/PhD headcounts.

gpu_resources.notes:
Clusters counted and node×GPU math:

1) RIS Compute2 (H100): Published total = 64 H100 GPUs. Compute2 hardware doc lists GPU node hostnames c2-gpu-[001-018] and GPU model H100 80GB, but does not state GPUs-per-node; to satisfy the published total, assumed 16 nodes × 4 H100 per node = 64 (counted as H100 PCIe due to lack of SXM statement).

2) RIS Compute1 / base V100 pool (V100): 120 V100 GPUs listed; nodes not provided; assumed 30 nodes × 4 V100 per node = 120.

3) RIS Arts & Sciences Condo (A100 80GB PCIe): 8 A100 PCIe 80GB listed; nodes not provided; assumed 2 nodes × 4 GPUs per node = 8.

4) Engineering Research Compute Cluster (LSF):
- A100 80GB SXM4: 3 nodes × 4 GPUs/node = 12
- A100 80GB PCIe: 1 node × 8 GPUs/node = 8
- A40 48GB: 2 nodes × 8 GPUs/node = 16

5) RCIF / CHPC (docs.chpc.wustl.edu):
- H100 SXM: gpuh[801-802] => 2 nodes × 4 = 8
- A100 80GB (SXM): gpua[801-805] => 5 nodes × 4 = 20
- A100 40GB: gpu01 => 1×4 = 4 (A100 PCIe 40GB) plus gpua[401-412] => 12×4 = 48 (A100 SXM 40GB) => total A100 40GB = 52
- V100/V100S: gpu02 (1×4=4 V100S), gpu03 (1×2=2 V100S), gpu04-05 (2×2=4 V100S) => V100S subtotal 10; gpu06 (1×4=4 V100), gpu07 (1×3=3 V100), gpu09 (1×4=4 V100) => V100 subtotal 11; total V100 family on RCIF = 21
- GH200: gpugh01 => 1 node × 1 = 1

Grand totals:
- H100 SXM = 8 (RCIF)
- H100 PCIe = 64 (Compute2, assumed)
- A100 80GB = 20 (RCIF) + 8 (A&S Condo) + 12 (Engineering SXM4) + 8 (Engineering PCIe) = 48
- A100 40GB = 52 (RCIF)
- V100 = 120 (RIS base) + 21 (RCIF) = 141
- A40 = 16 (Engineering)
All other requested GPU types not found => 0 [WARNING: Original source was inaccessible, using fallback.]

analysis_notes: Data collected via multi-query approach: separate student and GPU searches.
